Name: Funerary Slab of Aurelius Sabius
Description: The funerary slab decorated the tomb of a soldier of Syrian origin, Aurelius Sabius, of the Second Legion. He died at the age of 35.He is depicted in a standing pose, wearing a Roman toga and holding a long double-headed spear in his right hand. He is setting his shield on the floor with his left hand.His hair is thick and he is bearded. Beneath the scene there are three incised lines of Latin inscription.
